documentation.text: @notice allows the admin to submit the poll to the DAO for validation (validators will check for illegal content...)

@notice allows the admin to end the poll
@dev LATER : delay and number of answers will allow to set requirements to end the Poll by everybody (not only the owner), with incentives to automate the process
@notice allows the admin to withdraw the funds of the poll in case of rejection by the DAO or if the poll end without enough respondents
@notice allows to refund the owner in case of rejection by the DAO or if the poll end without enough respondents

addTopic(string,string[]).details: the choices are an array of string

params._choices: is an array of string representing the choices of the topic
params._question: is the question of the topic

addTopicsBatch(string[],string[][]).details: structure of choice : [topic choices][topics] / read/write : a.[topic n][choice n] / lenght : a.length == topics.length

params._choices: is an array of array of string representing the choices of the topics
params._questions: is an array of string representing the questions of the topics

endPoll().details: LATER : delay and number of answers will allow to set requirements to end the Poll by everybody (not only the owner), with incentives to automate the process

getPackedAnswers().details: answers are packed so each answer is a uint flagging the choices of the respondent

returns._0: answers is an array of uint representing the answers of the poll

getSelectedChoicesByAnswer(uint256).details: one answer is a uint256 where each bit represent an available choice : 1 is selected, 0 is not selected

params._answerId: is the index of the answer in the answers array

returns._0: an array of uint representing the selected choices of the respondent (in the order of all choices in topics)

getUnpackedAnswers().details: answers are unpacked so each result is the index of a choice selected by a respondentcall getSelectedChoicesByAnswer() to get the selected choices of a respondentuse answers.length to get the number of respondents

returns._0: an array of all respondets answers as an array of uint corresponding to the index of the choices selected by the respondent (reading :[choices][respondents])

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setPollValidation(address,bool).details: if the poll is validated, the DAO will pay the validators and the DAOif the poll is rejected, the DAO will refund the owner balance less the validators fees (owner should claim it back later)it set the timestampLimit to the end of the poll and start the poll

params.isValid: is a boolean to validate or reject the poll
params.pollAddress: is the address of the poll to validate (this contract)

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addTopic(string,string[]).notice: This function allows to add a topic : a question and its choices

addTopicsBatch(string[],string[][]).notice: This function allows to add topics : questions and their choices, in batch

claimRefund().notice: allows the admin to withdraw the funds of the poll in case of rejection by the DAO or if the poll end without enough respondents

endPoll().notice: allows the admin to end the poll

getPackedAnswers().notice: get all the answers of the poll

getSelectedChoicesByAnswer(uint256).notice: This function return the selected choices of topics of a respondent

getUnpackedAnswers().notice: get all the answers of the poll

setPollValidation(address,bool).notice: allows the DAO to validate or reject the poll

submitPoll().notice: allows the admin to submit the poll to the DAO for validation (validators will check for illegal content...)
